title: My Wes Bos 30
author: Ricardo Moreira
body:
# **What it is?**

After I finished the Wes Bos [course](https://beginnerjavascript.com/) about Javacript I decided to revist his free [course](https://javascript30.com/) and try to add my own take on his projects.
The first time I did the 30 days of Javascript I had created my own versions of some of his projects(more on than on the detailed explanation of each project) but mostly all of I took them as a new project. So I created some set of rules for it


## Rules

 Normally I dedicate an hour and a half per day( Monday to Friday) to a course. 

* The transformation of Wes Bos project had to be taken in that time frame, meaning after I end up a lesson, I have an hour and a half max to change the project to my own vision. 
* Every day I have to start a new lesson/project
* The transformations have to do with the topics of the lesson
* It had to include in some way, more javascript or at least change the existent one.

## Links

* [Project page](https://mytakeonjs30.netlify.app/)
* [GitHub page](https://github.com/mugas/MyWes30)

## Project by Project

### Drumkit

This was love at first sight but because of that, I think it blocked my thoughts.
After I saw the project for the first time, so many ideas start running to my head that when I want to put them on practice I couldn't.
Then I just end up adding more buttons with different sounds.

#### What changed?

* Only add more buttons with different sounds on each one.
* Change the background image

#### Links

* [Original](https://wesdrumkit.netlify.app/)
* [GitHub page](https://mydrumkit30.netlify.app/)

### Clock

This is here but is not included in the challenge. That is because I did this the first time I check this course. Because I never worked with libraries in the time, I wanted to add some date library. So I spent some time doing this one 2 years ago.After I finished I decided to add some animations and create a adversting for stop smoking.

#### What changed?

* Add date library(moment.js)
* Change the clock to have also the digital version 
* It shows the numbers of the hours
* Add animations to swing the clock

#### Links

* [Original](https://wesclock.netlify.app/)
* [GitHub page](https://myclock30.netlify.app/)

### CSS Variables

One hour and a half seems to much but when you start coding, it just goes to fast and you realize you end up doing nothing.
I added more pictures because I wanted to see how it works with many pictures at the same time. After I also had the possibility to add the width as a variable but that was not really changing or adding any Javascript. So after some reading about it, I end up adding a different cursor with css variables.

#### What changed?

* Add more pics instead of one
* User can also change the width of the picture
* The cursor has a colored circle made with css variables

#### Links

* [Original](https://wescssvariables.netlify.app/)
* [GitHub page](https://mycssvariables.netlify.app/)

### Flex Panels

First time I saw it, I picture it a perfect project for a restaurant or events page but I decided to keep the pictures and start playing with more classes and animations with the letters and the images

#### What changed?

* The text shows a gradient animation
* All pictures feature a grayscale that only disappears when pressed on the panel


#### Links

* [Original](https://wesflexpanel.netlify.app/)
* [GitHub page](https://myflexpanel.netlify.app/)
